page.title: 04ECOLOGY 1
page.content: The{River Stour}is still markedly tidal here although salt water does not reach this far up. Some species of sea fish come up as far as Plucks Gutter, i.e. Bass, Flounders, and Grey Mullet. There is a run of Sea-Trout. Of{Freshwater Fishes}the following are common: Bream, Dace, Eels, Gudgeon, Perch, Pike, Roach,Rudd Ruffe or Pope, Brown and Rainbow Trout, Tench. Other species such as Carp, Greyling, Chub, Barbel, and even Salmon are sometimes reported. The river bed is home to very large Fresh Water Mussels, and Crayfish are found in the dykes. Otters were common once, but none have been seen for 20 years - Wild Mink have been encountered. All the common {riverside birds,}Coots, Moorhens, and the like are to be seen, and if your lucky, a Kingfisher.
